str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To draw (as a sword), pull. A primary verb; to draw.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sword. Probably feminine of a presumed derivative of mache; a knife, i.e. Dirk; figuratively, war, judicial punishment.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To strike, smite, sting. A primary verb; to hit; specially, to sting.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take away, smite off. From apo and haireomai; to remove.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
An ear. Diminutive of ous; an earlet, i.e. One of the ears, or perhaps the lobe of the ear.
